data.title: Our regular place.
data.text: It is a bit hole in the wallish but the food is great. We either order large greek salads with grilled chicken for me and gyro meat for my husband if we are being good on our low carb diet or 1 gyro dinner with an extra pita and sauce and split it. You get a "small" greek salad, gyro and a whole bunch of fries with the dinner. There is so much meat on the gyro, the salad is twice as big as most dinner salads and you get so many fries it is no problem to share. The service is always great and we are frequently in a hurry. There is only 1 waitress on duty on Sundays evenings (our usual day to go) sometimes she has trouble keeping up if the place is packed but she does her best. Business varies 1 week it will be us and 1 other table and the next week people will be waiting for an empty table no rhyme or reason.

data.title: Delicious Gyros and Pizza.
data.text: Go for the great food. It isn't an art museum. These folks sell good food at a good price.    When you are done you can go for a walk downtown.

data.title: Nice Surprise!
data.text:
Third week of a long cross-country trip, and hubby was itching for pizza. We found this little gem in the beautiful college town of Columbia, and we are so happy we did!

Had the toasted ravioli appetizer which was served with fantastic marinara dipping sauce, and a small cheese pizza. Both were very, very good, and just enough for us.

This is a family-owned establishment that's been in the same location for 53 years. Ambiance is typical small Italian pizza place, and that made it all the better.

Loved it!

data.title: Average pizza
data.text: I was looking for a different pizza place in town and decided to give Tony's a try.  I have seen it many times before but never thought about going in until reading good reviews on another site.  I was hoping it would be New York style but it was actually Greek which is not my favorite.  Pizza was just ok, nothing great and for sure not as good as some of the other places in town.

data.title: So Sad
data.text: With great sadness I report that what was the very best gyros in Columbia for the past 3 decades is no longer even on the map. Tony's was never known for its delivery prowess, and that's ok because the quality of the food was always worth the wait. Unfortunately, the service has gotten worse and so has the food. The gyros are nearly tasteless. Tough review for me to write because I always loved this place. Hopefully they will get it back soon.

data.title: consistent excellent pizza, salad and gyro Run by the same Greek family for years
data.text:
Tony;s is a Columbia tradition.  Since the 1960s tonys has been providing a no frill place to eat in or take out the VERY BEST PIZZA IN TOWN.  The special cheese is one of the secret
my family has a standing order  pizza 1/2 canadian bacon 1.2 mushroom and greek salad with lots of fresh feta cheese crumbles. a Must visit is you are checking out one of columbia;s three colleges the university of Missouri,
the first university of the louisanna purchase and the first public university west of the mississippli
stephens college the second women college founded in the US and Columbia College another long standing institution of higher learing.

data.title: Great food
data.text: We stop here whenever we are in Colombia. The pizza is really good and the Greek salad is loaded with feta cheese.

data.title: Don't let the exterior fool you
data.text: Tony's is a little run down, but they have been pumping out thin crust pizzas for years. Nothing is too fancy in Tony's and the thin crust might be an acquired taste, but the pizza is good, the beer is cold, and the Greek salads are huge. Great change of pace and a reminder of years gone by.

data.title: Classic Greek
data.text: Tony's has been in Columbia for at least 50 years.  It is located in a shabby building with shabby decor.  Forget shabby because the food is exceptional.  Greek pizzas are loaded with cheese and meat.  Pizzas are not cut into pie wedges but rather as little squares.  The Greek salad has a wonderful lemon dressing rather than vinegar, loaded with feta and the lettuce is crisp and cold.  A small salad can feed two.  The gyro is authentic in flavor, spices and texture--not the thin sliced commercial pet-food-like gyro meat you find elsewhere.  If you are in a hurry, you might order other menu items because the authentic Greek fare is pretty much made from scratch and takes extra time.  The families that own Tony's seem to rotate between Missouri and Greece.  Many of the guys preparing the food have been there for decades.  The table service is cheerful.  Don't wait for your check, go to the cash register and they will figure it up.  My favorite is the gyro dinner with great bread, lots of meat, onions, tomatoes, tzatziki sauce and fries that taste like they are real and not frozen.  The shishkabob is also excellent with cubes of pork.  The Tony's Special is a great pizza.

data.title: Spagetthi
data.text: The sauces are wonderful.  I'm always amazed at how inexpensive a family can eat.  Gyros are outstanding and the sauce is from a family recipe!  No they will not share it with you but you'll want to return many times.

data.title: Pizza brings back memories
data.text: During college, we practically lived at Tony's. We must have ordered pizza at least 5 times a week and at all hours of the day. A recent trip back demanded we revisit Tony's and am happy to report it is still as good as I remember. The location has changed but it is still family run -- the same family that started it back in the 70s. Here the cheese is on TOP of the ingredients and this works well. A trip down memory lane worked out thanks to Tony's
